titleStmt.title: An essay concerning a vacuum Wherein is endeavoured to be demonstrated, that a vacuum interspersum runs through the world, and is more or less in all bodies. By a lover of the corpuscular philosophy.
titleStmt.author: Jackson, Joseph, fl. 1695-

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Andrew Bell at the Cross-keys and Bible in Cornhil, near Stocks-market,

notesStmt.note: A lover of the corpsucular philosophy = Joseph Jackson. Cf. Wing.
Text begins on p. 3, which is A2.
With an advertisement bound at end.
Reproduction of the original in the Edinburgh University Library, Edinburgh.
